page.title: 01HARESFIELD & STANDISH AREA
page.content: The main feature of our block is the steep escarpment of the western edge of the Cotswold Hills from which there are many fine views over the Severn Vale, especially from Haresfield Beacon. There are many valleys and dells, mostly used for rough grazing. The roads are steep and winding. On the south east side of our block, on the hills lie Randwick Woods. The western edge of the block is down in the Severn Vale. This level land is intensively farmed. The railway line from Gloucester to Bristol and Stroud runs here. The small villages of Standish, Little Haresfield and Stroud Green lie in our block,together with parts of Whiteshill, Ruscombe, and a small part of Haresfield. The nearest town is Stroud.
